snippet: A state judge on Wednesday temporarily blocked enforcement of a law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals.
abstract: North Dakota judge temporarily blocks enforcement of law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals; law would have forced closure of  state's only abortion center, in Fargo, because it uses out-of-state doctors who have been refused such admitting privileges.
lead_paragraph: A state judge on Wednesday temporarily blocked enforcement of a law requiring doctors who perform abortions to have admitting privileges at nearby hospitals.

headline.main: Abortion Law Is Blocked in North Dakota
headline.print_headline: North Dakota: Abortion Law Is Blocked
